Act5Scene4.speaker: Malcolm
Act5Scene4.text: Cousins, I hope the days are near at hand that chambers will be safe.

Act5Scene4.speaker: Siward
Act5Scene4.text: What wood is this before us?

Act5Scene4.speaker: Malcolm
Act5Scene4.text: Let every soldier hew him down a bough And bear â€™t before him.
Act5Scene4.translation: Every soldier should cut down a branch and hold it in front of them.

Act5Scene4.speaker: Malcolm
Act5Scene4.text: Thereby shall we shadow the numbers of our host and make discovery err in report of us.
Act5Scene4.translation: This way it will be difficult for Macbeth's spies to get an accurate report of our numbers.

Act5Scene4.speaker: Siward
Act5Scene4.text: The time approaches that will with due decision make us know what we shall say we have and what we owe.
Act5Scene4.translation: The time approaches in which we will know what we have accomplished and what we still need to do.

Act5Scene4.speaker: Siward
Act5Scene4.text: Thoughts speculative their unsure hopes relate, But certain issue strokes must arbitrate; Towards which, advance the war.
Act5Scene4.translation: Speculation only leads to uncertainty. We will only get certainty by going out and fighting. So let's start this war.
